item.title: Damage Blocking Item (?)
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

[quote=“gawdz666, post:13, topic:343109”][quote author=adu link=topic=439508.msg3229786#msg3229786 date=1275941581]

I don’t get why people ‘release’ little things like this, there’s a million different combinations of random shit you could release such as a Chicken hitting you harder if you don’t wear Gloves but why would you? I’m sure even snoopy89 could manage that on his own.

Why do you care so much about what people release or don’t release? So what if there are a million different combinations of random stuff that you can release? Let there be a million posts of people releasing random stuff, why do you care?

Atleast he is contributiog something to the community unlike your posts in the development section which is pretty much “Ooo look at what zlient coded for my server”.

[/quote]

Or…

Lmao, I cant get enough of that. Classic.

item.title: Damage Blocking Item (?)
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

Motaro:

Doesn’t working against players I don’t think.

Obviously, considering you’re only doing it if the attacker object is an instance of the NPC class…

I think you need to learn how if statements, and operators work, considering that is somewhat of important…

Read full topic

item.title: Damage Blocking Item (?)
item.dc:creator: @Motaro Motaro
item.description:
@Motaro wrote:

IDK what to call it but it’s a kinda cool idea I thought of. When wearing an item, it will block 25%of the NPC’s hits. Kinda like a random paralyze monster throughout the fight when wearing something.

In FightEvent.java, replace

if(attacker instanceof Npc && opponent.isPrayerActivated(12)) { return; }

with

if(attacker instanceof Npc && opponent.isPrayerActivated(12)) { return; } else if (attacker instanceof Npc && owner.getInventory().wielding(1278)){ if(DataConversions.random(0, 3) == 1){ return; } }

Would mean if you wear a dragon sq you have a 25% of not getting hit while fighting.

Doesn’t working against players I don’t think.

Read full topic
